software.description:
The Gibbs' connectome is a set of ready-processed high-dimensional structural and functional connectivity matrices and group fibertract information of 169 subjects. The data is based on the openly available NKI enhanced Rockland sample (http://fcon_1000.projects.nitrc.org/indi...) which represents a state-of-the-art community sample. To estimate a group connectome of fiber tracts, the Gibbs' tracking algorithm has been applied to each subjects dMRI data. Fiber tracts have been normalized into standard space using DARTEL.
Explicit methodology of the data set is described here:
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26327...
